attributes.action: PM to discuss inhumae treatment of refugees on Nauru by the Australia  govt.
attributes.additional_details: Asylum seekers have been subjected to sexual abuse and assault by immigration officials.  a young girl said a male asylum seeker had “cut her from under”.Seven reports of sexual assault of children, 59 reports of assault on children, 30 of self-harm involving children and 159 of threatened self-harm involving children are recorded.This request is for Parliament authorise the FM to intervene.
attributes.background:
Australia runs a refugee camp on the Pacific island nation of Nauru.
Rights group say conditions these camps are totally inadequate, citing poor hygiene, cramped conditions, unrelenting heat and a lack of facilities, there are disturbing reports of sexual abuse.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the UK Government or Parliament to take a specific action. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. For example, you could call for a debate in the UK Parliament about the treatment of refugees on Nauru. Or you could start a petition asking the UK Government to urge the Australian Government to take action.
